ibis.io
Class SunSerializationInputStream

java.lang.Object
  java.io.InputStream
      java.io.ObjectInputStream
          ibis.io.SunSerializationInputStream
All Implemented Interfaces:
SerializationInput, Closeable, DataInput, ObjectInput, ObjectStreamConstants
public final class SunSerializationInputStream
extends ObjectInputStream
implements SerializationInput

The SunSerializationInputStream class is the "glue" between SerializationInputStream and ObjectInputStream. It provides implementations for the abstract methods in SerializationInputStream, built on methods in ObjectInputStream.

clear

public void clear()
Dummy reset. For Ibis, we want to be able to remove the object table in a SerializationInputStream. With Sun serialization, this is accomplished by sending a RESET to it. For Ibis serialization, we cannot do this because we can only send a RESET when a handle is expected.

Specified by:
clear in interface SerializationInput

statistics

public void statistics()
No statistics are printed for the Sun serialization version.

Specified by:
statistics in interface SerializationInput

readArray

public void readArray(boolean[] ref,
                      int off,
                      int len)
               throws IOException
Read a slice of an array of booleans. A consequence of the Ibis ReadMessage interface is that a copy has to be made here, because ObjectInputStream has no mechanism to read an array "in place".

Parameters:
ref - the array to be read
off - offset in the array from where reading starts
len - the number of elements to be read
Throws:
IOException - when something is wrong.

readArray

public void readArray(Object[] ref,
                      int off,
                      int len)
               throws IOException,
                      ClassNotFoundException
Read a slice of an array of Objects. See readArray(boolean[], int, int) for a description.

Specified by:
readArray in interface SerializationInput
Parameters:
ref - array in which the slice is stored
off - offset where the slice starts
len - length of the slice (the number of elements)
Throws:
IOException - is thrown on an IO error.
ClassNotFoundException - is thrown when the class of a serialized object is not found.
